tags: turning my account into a marvel trash account
title: Favourite MCU lines
body:
“That guy’s brain is a bag full of cats. You can smell crazy on him.”

“You get hurt, hurt ‘em back. You get killed… walk it off.”

“If it were any smarter, it’d write a book - a book that would make Ulysses look like it was written in crayon." 

"Sir, I’m gonna have to ask you to exit the donut.”

“I can do this all day." 

"There’s only one God, ma'am, and I’m pretty sure he doesn’t dress like that.”

“I told you, I don’t want to join your super-secret boy band." 

"Drop your socks and grab your crocs, we’re about to get wet on this ride.” (an absolute favourite)

“Well, dying is certainly better than having to live an entire life as a moronic shitbag who thinks 'Taserface’ is a cool name.”

“Geez, somebody get that kid a sandwich!”

“So are you two… do you… fondue?” (Steve is an icon)

“Shakespeare in the park? Doth mother know you weareth her drapes?" 

"I need a horse.”

BASICALLY EVERY LINE FROM EVERY MARVEL MOVIE, BUT I WASN’T ABOUT TO WRITE THE WHOLE SCRIPT…

blog.name: thefandomimagine
blog.title: The Fandom Imagine
blog.description: Buy Me A Coffee Patreon Page WARNING:These tags do include NSFW posts Marvel Doctor Who Harry Potter LOTR Sherlock Supernatural Star Wars OUAT Teen Wolf DC Others Oneshots Aesthetic Fake Texts Headcanons Moodboards NSFW An imagines blog for any and all fandoms. Please note that I do not own any of the gifs used and if you see any of your own gifs, then message me and I will happily put your name in the tags, to give credit where credit is due or remove it if that is what you wish. You are always welcome to write stories based on any of the imagines I myself will do gif imagines, fake texts, aesthetics and headcanons. However any oneshots on the blog are wrote by followers. If you wish to submit a oneshot idea than I will post it to everyone, however it is up to them if it is actually published. NSFW posts are published on the last Sunday of the month. All fandoms are welcome.

summary:
Do you guys ever imagine Peter being a whiny brat to his dads/mom? He would;
cry and try to bother tony when he wants something....
body:
Do you guys ever imagine Peter being a whiny brat to his dads/mom? He would;

  • cry and try to bother tony when he wants something. no matter what tony’s doing
  • steal steve’s shield until he notices so he gets attention
  • covers thor’s axe with spider web so he would annoy him to get what he wants
  • web clint’s ammo and bow to the ceiling and would be sitting next to it so casually
  • put web all over natasha’s hair, does the same to loki
  • hide stephen’s spell books
  • continuously babble about bucky’s metal arm

summary: the reason i love loki is because he’s the only one who’s willing to cut a couple corners to get shit done. all these...
body: the reason i love loki is because he’s the only one who’s willing to cut a couple corners to get shit done. all these superheroes are gryffindors to the core who are too “honorable” to use deception to save the world and sometimes you just need a slytherin to go up to a fuckwit like thanos and say “yes you are the almighty and i am in awe of your power, let me help you and your cause” while weilding a knife behind your back. it’s not about ethics it’s about getting shit done

tags: it's not an innocence debate it’s just about facts
and if it were about innocence i'd still say he has the coercion in his favor
he's not totally exonerated the way bucky is because the brainwashing wasn’t to the same extent
nevertheless he clearly suffered and was made to do things that he wouldn’t have done in his right mind
most of the blame deserves to land on thanos's shoulders
but that part is just my feelings about it
blame and innocence and all other factors are subjective
the truth of what happened is not
summary: It’s interesting seeing people get so bent out of shape over Marvel’s confirmation that Loki was influenced by the Mind Stone....
body:
It’s interesting seeing people get so bent out of shape over Marvel’s confirmation that Loki was influenced by the Mind Stone. Some people are upset and saying that it frees him of the blame, but it’s not like it’s exonerating him entirely, he did have some measure of control and they’re not trying to say that he didn’t, but it took what he was already feeling - anger towards Thor and jealousy towards Midgard - and twisted it into something that made him do what he would not have done in his right mind. It’s not a retcon. Tom and Joss had discussions about what happened to Loki between movies before they filmed The Avengers, it was intended this whole time that he was being controlled. It’s shown in the movie that people are negatively affected by being in a certain proximity to the scepter - see the Avengers getting into pointless heated arguments and Bruce picking it up without even knowing he was doing it. Loki had that thing on him nearly the whole time. Of course it did something to him. There’s even evidence that it was messing with his memories, due to things such as recalling being tossed into the abyss, when in reality he was the one who intentionally let go as a suicide attempt. The Stone got inside his mind and rearranged the contents.

Mind Stone aside, there’s every evidence that there was physical torture as well. In the end credits of Thor, he looks utterly rotten. He’s dirty, he’s bruised all over and has what appear to be burn marks, there’s blood in his teeth. He’s been through the wringer. When we see him at the beginning of The Avengers, he looks horrendously unwell, like he’s been starved and dehydrated for who knows how long. He limps and has to hold onto things for balance, including an agent who had to help him up from outright falling down - something his pride would not allow to happen if he didn’t seriously require it. Something has clearly happened to him, and between that and the threats he receives from The Other on behalf of Thanos, it’s not difficult to figure out what.

“If you fail, if the Tesseract is kept from us, there will be no realm, no barren moon where he cannot find you. You think you know pain? He will make you long for something sweet as pain!” Those are The Other’s exact words, and Loki is shaking and crying when he hears them. He shakes and cries in a sizable portion of the movie, actually. He has horrible threats against him to keep him in line during his more lucid moments. Even when he has more control of himself and his actions, he’s being coerced under threat of unimaginable torture, worse than what’s he’s already suffered, and he has to keep up the act or he’s toast. He’s still responsible for his choices, but the reason behind them is understandable.

And it’s been like that from the beginning. This is the way it was written, and Tom made many deliberate acting choices based on that. He has confirmed that intent. One has to willfully ignore everything to make the claim that Loki wasn’t influenced in any way, that he was just having the time of his life being evil. It’s undeniable that Thanos had a very large part to play. This isn’t something new and it’s not a retcon of his character history, they’re not just going with it because it was a popular theory and they want to cater to the fans. It’s not even about giving him a defense so that he can look good. They’re literally just acknowledging what has been true the whole time. Loki was canonically influenced by the Mind Stone and by Thanos.

reblog.comment:

Some people are upset and saying that it frees him of the blame, but it’s not like it’s exonerating him entirely, he did have some measure of control and they’re not trying to say that he didn’t, but it took what he was already feeling - anger towards Thor and jealousy towards Midgard - and twisted it into something that made him do what he would not have done in his right mind. Even when he has more control of himself and his actions, he’s being coerced under threat of unimaginable torture, worse than what’s he’s already suffered, and he has to keep up the act or he’s toast. He’s still responsible for his choices, but the reason behind them is understandable.

And it’s been like that from the beginning. This is the way it was written, and Tom made many deliberate acting choices based on that. He has confirmed that intent. One has to willfully ignore everything to make the claim that Loki wasn’t influenced in any way, that he was just having the time of his life being evil. It’s undeniable that Thanos had a very large part to play. This isn’t something new and it’s not a retcon of his character history, they’re not just going with it because it was a popular theory and they want to cater to the fans. It’s not even about giving him a defense so that he can look good. They’re literally just acknowledging what has been true the whole time. Loki was canonically influenced by the Mind Stone and by Thanos.

trail.content_raw:
It’s interesting seeing people get so bent out of shape over Marvel’s confirmation that Loki was influenced by the Mind Stone. Some people are upset and saying that it frees him of the blame, but it’s not like it’s exonerating him entirely, he did have some measure of control and they’re not trying to say that he didn’t, but it took what he was already feeling - anger towards Thor and jealousy towards Midgard - and twisted it into something that made him do what he would not have done in his right mind. It’s not a retcon. Tom and Joss had discussions about what happened to Loki between movies before they filmed The Avengers, it was intended this whole time that he was being controlled. It’s shown in the movie that people are negatively affected by being in a certain proximity to the scepter - see the Avengers getting into pointless heated arguments and Bruce picking it up without even knowing he was doing it. Loki had that thing on him nearly the whole time. Of course it did something to him. There’s even evidence that it was messing with his memories, due to things such as recalling being tossed into the abyss, when in reality he was the one who intentionally let go as a suicide attempt. The Stone got inside his mind and rearranged the contents.

Mind Stone aside, there’s every evidence that there was physical torture as well. In the end credits of Thor, he looks utterly rotten. He’s dirty, he’s bruised all over and has what appear to be burn marks, there’s blood in his teeth. He’s been through the wringer. When we see him at the beginning of The Avengers, he looks horrendously unwell, like he’s been starved and dehydrated for who knows how long. He limps and has to hold onto things for balance, including an agent who had to help him up from outright falling down - something his pride would not allow to happen if he didn’t seriously require it. Something has clearly happened to him, and between that and the threats he receives from The Other on behalf of Thanos, it’s not difficult to figure out what.

“If you fail, if the Tesseract is kept from us, there will be no realm, no barren moon where he cannot find you. You think you know pain? He will make you long for something sweet as pain!” Those are The Other’s exact words, and Loki is shaking and crying when he hears them. He shakes and cries in a sizable portion of the movie, actually. He has horrible threats against him to keep him in line during his more lucid moments. Even when he has more control of himself and his actions, he’s being coerced under threat of unimaginable torture, worse than what’s he’s already suffered, and he has to keep up the act or he’s toast. He’s still responsible for his choices, but the reason behind them is understandable.

And it’s been like that from the beginning. This is the way it was written, and Tom made many deliberate acting choices based on that. He has confirmed that intent. One has to willfully ignore everything to make the claim that Loki wasn’t influenced in any way, that he was just having the time of his life being evil. It’s undeniable that Thanos had a very large part to play. This isn’t something new and it’s not a retcon of his character history, they’re not just going with it because it was a popular theory and they want to cater to the fans. It’s not even about giving him a defense so that he can look good. They’re literally just acknowledging what has been true the whole time. Loki was canonically influenced by the Mind Stone and by Thanos.
